section.name: JSF Extensions
section.p: This project hosts development of software that extends the capability of the JavaServer Faces specification, including revolutionary, world class, support for using AJAX and JSF. Software within this project is intended to run on any JSF compliant implementation, but in some cases the capabilities are enhanced when run with Sun's implementation.

Similar to the Struts Shale project, JSF Extensions is delived as separate software parts, you can choose to use any combination of them, apart or together. The software is groupd into three areas based on when in the software development lifecycle they should be used.

li.p: JSF and AJAX together: it just works. JSF-Extensions run-time brings the power of AJAX to existing and future JSF developed applications. Included in this software is an implementation of the Avatar concept demonstrated by Jacob Hookom Ed Burns, and Adam Winer in their JavaOne 2006 talk. JSF-Extensions avatar is also the best way to use jMaki.
Bring the "flash" concept from Ruby on Rails to your JSF applications!

subsection.name: Test Time
subsection.p: Sun's JSF implementation uses Cactus, JUnit, and HTMLUnit for its automated testing. We have extracted the testing framework from Sun's JSF implementation codebase and now offer it in this project. This is a general purpose testing framework for JSF applications. Sun's JSF implementation now depends on jsf-extensions for its testing framework.

subsection.name: Design Time
subsection.p: Sun's JSF implementation uses code generation to automatically create the JSP Tag Handlers and TLD files for the core jsf components. We plan to extract this (or similar) code and offer it as part of this project.
